member_organisations: EASO is a federation of 32 national obesity associations, representing approximately 5000 individuals.  See http://easo.org/membership/
fields_of_interest: Consumers, Education and training, Employment and Social Affairs, Youth, Regional Policy, Research and innovation, Public Health, Food Safety, Digital economy and society, Communication
eu_initiatives: Member of the EU Platform on Diet, Physical Activity and Health.  member of the JPI HDHL Stakeholder Advisory Board.  Occational participant in JRC and JANPA consultations.
organisation_name: European Association for the Study of Obesity (EASO)
subsection: Non-governmental organisations, platforms and networks and similar
commission_expert_groups_and_other_simil: European Platform for Action on Diet, Physical Activity and Health#E00845#http://ec.europa.eu/transparency/regexpert/index.cfm?do=groupDetail.groupDetail&groupID=845#Member#C
membership: WOF.  European Biomedical Alliance.  Also, in official relations with the WHO Regional Office for Europe.
goals__remit:
Mission: To reduce the burden of unhealthy weight  
 
The Objectives of EASO are: 
 
- To establish obesity as an urgent and relevant health and wellbeing priority 
 
- To develop evolving evidence-based approaches for preventing and treating obesity across the lifespan 
 
- To promote effective solutions through research, education and policy.
relevant_communication: Dissemination partner in ongoing EU projects MooDFOOD (FP7) and NoHoW (H2020).  Recent partner in FP7 projects DORIAN and Spotlight. Organiser of the annual European Congress on Obesity (ECO) and European Obesity Day (EOD).  EASO publishes position statements and guidelines in Obesity Facts (OFA), see http://easo.org/education-portal/guidelines/
